website_summaries.verdict: A workhorse travel crib that can be used at home or on the go until baby is ready to be in a big-kid bed.
pros: Includes wheels to make it easy to move after you have it set up
Large enough to keep baby entertained with a few toys
Folds into a rectangle and comes with a carrying bag for easy transport
cons: This model does not come with an infant bassinet attachment like others on the market

customer_reviews.title: Used as baby bed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for first grandchild overnight visits. Read all reviews and chose this one. Very happy with sturdiness, well made product. Easy to assemble and disassemble. Also purchased Dream On Me 3" Rounded Corner Playyard Mattress--perfect combo.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: BE CAREFUL!!!!! Do not add ...
customer_reviews.text: BE CAREFUL!!!!! Do not add any additional mattresses to this product! There have been reports of suffocation( check the WEB yourself) when the original mattress that comes with the play yard is modified in any way. There is a warning label on the product itself and in the instruction manual indicating this.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Buslepp

customer_reviews.title: polyurethane In mattress pad
customer_reviews.text: So I loved these and bought 2 of them until I noticed the pad itself is made out of polyurethane. polyurethane Is a known chemical that can cause birth defects and lower your baby’s IQ. I specifically don’t have foam mattress or flam retardant mattress for this reason, so I’m at a loss as to why graco is using polyurethane in a pack and play that is made for infants and toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! Super compact! Purchased the dream on me play yard mattress for it and it fits perfectly! My baby loves sleeping in it And I love that I can keep her close to me and see her through the mesh Very comfortable and way cheaper than buying a crib
customer_reviews.author: alinka

customer_reviews.title: Very cute and perfect for baby
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and my daughter slept like a champ in it! It does have a strong chemical smell when it's first opened but I'm sure it'll air out in a few days. Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Never again. I ordered the mattress for my newborn in September, by February I was already contacting Graco to replace the pad at the bottom as it started creasing and ended up being s huge 2-3in raised part in the middle that my son couldn’t get over and was a suffocation hazard. Graco replaced my pad within a few weeks but the replacement has done the exact same thing. I will be return this to Graco. If I could give this no stars, I would. Not even putting the Graco pack and play pad cover helped. As you can see in pictures it held the bunched up pad down some but not completely
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Moody

customer_reviews.title: GREAT playard!!
customer_reviews.text: My ten month old granddaughter sleeps and plays comfortably in this playard. It is so handy. Easy to set up and break down. Easy to throw in the trunk of the car for travel. I use it all weekend. I can move it from room to room, so that I can keep an eye on her and I am visible to her all the time. I got the mattress appropriate for this playard. She wakes up happy.
customer_reviews.author: samia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Product for Traveling Crib
customer_reviews.text: We have a pack and play at home for our 15 month old. This is perfect for traveling because we only need the playyard to act as a crib when he sleeps! I had it shipped to my mom and dad so we would not have to check it three times on our vacation and now they have one at their house for our future trips!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, but a little heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what we need. The price was excellent at the time $30! We have used this a few times already for our 6 month old while we worked in the yard. We just put a crip sheet over the top to shade our little redhead and minimize bugs. It is big and bulky and easy to operate once you know what your doing. Ready to take it camping and travel.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M. Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to setup and take down!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this play yard for our grandson to have a safe place to play when he visits. Setup is a breeze, and it is very sturdy. We feel good knowing he has his own space to "hang out" in. It looks good, folds up into a very manageable size with its cover. We anticipate many more grandchildren will use this as we have 6 children of our own! Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: CherylB

customer_reviews.title: Missing bassinet.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with this one. Was needing it by June 22 as we needed to travel and go on vacation. We got it today but it was missing the bassinet and the hanging toy. With my back and short stature I can’t go on and trying to bend over and pick up a baby from the bottom of that crib. I’m returning it for a full refund since replacing it would be too late as we need to travel this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chua

customer_reviews.title: So many practical uses!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a 2-story house and I bought this as a secondary to keep downstairs. Baby has been using it since he was a newborn in the raised position and it's perfect for tummy time, changes, and naps. TIP: The Fisher-Price Kick & Play Piano Gym fits perfectly inside and it keeps our baby entertained without using the floor (so it's perfect when grandma takes care of the baby). We've also taken it to other places and once you learn how to pack and unpack, it's really easy and quick. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gabs

customer_reviews.title: Matt develops hard lumpy line
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in the quality of the mat inside the pack n’ play. This seem has come out in both of the Pack n’ plays. Matt develops hard lumpy line
customer_reviews.author: Mermaidme

customer_reviews.title: Easy to open and close
customer_reviews.text: It was really easy to open and close. It is very light to move around and very beautiful. The padding is a little hard so if you want comfort, you should purchase a mattress also.
customer_reviews.author: AMARILIS C

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Easy Assemble, Baby likes
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was delayed, but pack n play arrived right on time. Baby Girl #2 arrived very quickly on Monday morning. Assembly was very easy, had everything set up in less than 15 minutes. The bassinet fits right inside the pack n play & its high enough that I can see my Little One when I'm laying on my bed. The smaller size fits well in my apartment. My baby girl really likes her space. I will be buying a fitted sheet for the bassinet pad. It has been really cold at night and the pad gets cold too. A sheet will add extra warmth
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squeekes and mattress slats go on top of each other
customer_reviews.text: This pack and play is horrible. We started using it when my son was six months old (he is now one) It squeekes all the time. It even wakes him up when he is moving in his sleep. The other issue I have with it is the wooden slats inside the mattress go on top of one another and create a bump. My old pack and play matress had a super to fix the slats but this doesn't. I hate for my child to have to sleep on a bump. Having to correct the slats every night and flatten them out is very frustrating. I wouldn't put base this again.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: What happened to this brand
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pack and play for our 2nd kid. The playard does not have a zipper on the side so we have to cary our toddler every time to put him in instead of opening the zipper and having him go in by himself. Also, the upper rods were so hard to assemble them, i had to pull so hard to make them click and i hurt my back so badly to do it. Literally a disaster. Get the old ones that have the zipper on the side if you can
customer_reviews.author: R. A.

customer_reviews.title: Bassinet defective
customer_reviews.text: I had this product shipped twice to me. Yet both times, the bassinet was defective. There are supposed to be support straps sewed into the mesh (I even checked with Graco). But both times this product arrived, the support straps were not sewn in the mesh. The photos show the Pack N Play how I received (2 photos showing no support straps). The picture on the sticker shows the support straps helping to stabilize the bassinet.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Easy to set up and love the color combination. A little Diva look for my new great granddaughter. I babysit my great granddaughter a couple days a week, so I went back to my old standby, Graco, for the baby gear I needed. The upper position works great for diaper changes and naps for now, she's only 2 months, and the wheels on one end make it easy to move out of the room when she isn't here. Hopefully, this Graco Playard will last as long as all of the other Graco baby gear we have purchased over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Nonna of 6

customer_reviews.title: Indentation on mattress after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: I’m not impressed with this product as I feel Graco has such a monopoly on pack and plays that are affordable. After research and all of the great reviews we got this to use for travel and as a bassinet for our newborns first 4-5 months of life in our bedroom. The mattress has, from pretty early on, formed an indentation on where she lays. You can see where her body and head are. She’s within the weight and development specs to be using the mattress. It is upsetting as she gets “stuck” in the same position now she’s started moving more which I feel works against her development when something impedes movement. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Second one is as good as our first.
customer_reviews.text: Our second one. As the number of grandchildren grows, so did the demand for a second Pack 'n Play. We love the first one and same with this one. Be sure to add the mattress as it adds to the comfort when using as a bed for infants. Easy and fast setup and teardown.
customer_reviews.author: Jack DTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Travel Crib and Play Yard is even better!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Graco Travel Crib and Play Yard when I was expecting my first of three boys back in the early 1990's. While I was not surprised that the current product has attention to safety details and is even more convenient in the way that it folds away or sets-up, I was delighted that you can now purchase accessories like a diaper organizer! This was a wonderful way to keep a child safe while quickly using the restroom or baking and helping a little one be in sight but not in danger! I also love the bassinette/changing surface for infants, another feature not offered back in my day. Remember, Parents, these are great for taking on picnics too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We just got the Graco pack n' plays for my in-laws and they are SO much better. The extra $10 is so worth it
customer_reviews.text: We had been using the Cosco brand pack n' plays for the first year and a half of my twins' lives when we traveled and at my parents' house. We just got the Graco pack n' plays for my in-laws and they are SO much better. The extra $10 is so worth it; the quality is better, it's easier to set up and they don't STINK (the Cosco brand still have an awful plastic smell that lingers on the baby even after having them - and using them - for 1.5 yrs). If I could do it again I would have gotten these from the get-go. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JLLinNY

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy -HOLE. UNSAFE
customer_reviews.text: There is a big HOLE in the seam. Clearly a manufacturing defect. We bought this during prime day when I was barely pregnant. Fast forward 10 months later, I got to use it for the first time (Baby is a few months old) and there is a big hole in the seam where the mesh meets the bottom of the pack n play. Too late to return or exchange. I should have opened it ahead of time, so yes, that is my fault. But now I have to deal with Graco and hope they do something about it because it is not safe for my daughter to be in. What a bummer!!
customer_reviews.author: Twinmommahc

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple pack and play without a ton of bells, whistles, or accessories, and that's exactly what I was looking for. The bassinet feature is great while our little girl is smaller, and when she starts getting bigger, it'll be handy to have it as not only a play yard but as a kind of portable spare crib. Also adore the green/brown color scheme of my model. It's so hard to find neutral, earthy colors for baby things, so I jumped at this one when I saw it.
customer_reviews.author: Julia S.

customer_reviews.title: Mattress buckles
customer_reviews.text: This pack n play is 6 months old and the mattress is already starting to buckle/not lay flat. A flat mattress is necessary for safe sleep!! I purchased this one as a travel one to keep at a family member's house before I saw our other Graco Pack N Play was doing the same thing. Looks like I will have to call their 1800 number again and wait for 45 minutes to get a replacement mattress. Save yourself time assembling and a headache with the mattress and buy a 4 Moms one.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Review

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pack
customer_reviews.text: This pack and play is amazing it easily folds up and packed away and makes it easy to travel with or put away to clean up a little, I would recommend getting a mattress for the pack and play because the mattress it comes with is not that great. We bought a third-party mattress which is a lot thicker and softer than the one provided. It makes it much more comfortable for the baby with a thicker mattress. This is our babies normal sleeping spot for overnights and it works out great. And when we travel we can just take it with us.
customer_reviews.author: FAIZ

customer_reviews.title: So EASY to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I love the appearance of the graco pack n play. It is age appropriate. I placed my 9mo old grandson in it. I have also placed my 1yr old granddaughter in it. My 4 yr old granddaughter fell asleep in it. (All at separate times). Did not arrive on time. Arrived a day late. When I recieved it very early this morning. I immediately had my husband set up. It very easy to assemble, fold and unfold.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Grandma is HAPPY!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Folds compactly and even has 2 wheels so I can scoot it across the room (sans baby of course. I bought the Dream on me 3” mattress to go with it and I’m glad I did. The enclosed mattress is hard as a rock with <1” foam. Even my daughter in law said that I did good (that’s worth a TON)!!! No entrapment risk, see my photos. It’s perfect for this first time proud grandma and I’m delighted with it. Great value and came fast!! The days are long but the years are fast. If I dare blink he’ll be in college before I know it just like his daddy, my first baby.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I am a single Grammy for my little 9 month old granddaughter. My son put this together which was basically just unfolding it. I was able to open and close it by myself (with Rheumatoid Arthritis) and get it into the bag by myself. The little buttons on the sides have to be pushed to open and close it (to get it to lock) and I love it and it is not too heavy to carry it once it is in the bag if you aren't going super far with it. The padding is nice, seems plenty, sturdy and we had no issues with it. Nice purchase!
customer_reviews.author: memphisrain

customer_reviews.title: Almost a homerun
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality, and ease of use Graco pack n plays provide. Easy to set up, easy to move, and easy to take down. Sturdy. Easy to clean. Not terribly heavy. The bassinet attachment is easy and secure. I would have given this 5 stars, but......... The toy bar is pretty boring. No biggie. What is a bigger deal is this: The bassinet does not fold up with the pack n play. Furthermore, it does not fit inside the mat and bag with the rest of the pack n play. It is a real bummer that the whole setup isn't self contained. Takes away from its neat storage and its portability
customer_reviews.author: Whimsical

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need, nothing you don't.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous PnP. Doesn't have all the crazy bells and whistles, but we learned with out first baby (when we bought a fancy one with all the options) that you don't actually use most of them, and the others you don't use for long. The only extra feature that mattered to me was the ability to raise the "mattress" up to the bassinet height. When we had twins we needed a second PnP for travel and now we actually prefer this one to our fancy one because it folds a little smaller even though it's the same size. Save money (and hassle) and buy this instead of one with a recline cradle and changing table and yada yada.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole and Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Works, but missing toy strings
customer_reviews.text: This pack and play is everything you'd expect except that the toy bar that comes with the hanging stars were missing the strings the stars hang from. Not big enough of an issue to return, but super annoying that babe has nothing to look at and now I've got to buy my own toy bar. Other than that, it works. Small but effective. Super small fold. Can't comment on comfort of play mat because I purchased the 3in dream on me mattress (which fit perfectly btw). Good cheap option, especially if it's the last baby.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Solid pack n play
customer_reviews.text: The Graco pack n'play has been a standard for years and this one lives up to that. The mattress has straps that feed through the bottom of the pack n'play to snap onto the frame. While this does add a level of security so the mattress stays put, it's a bit of a hassle if you're setting up and taking it down frequently. Nothing that would make me not recommend it, just something to be aware of. I did purchase extra sheets so that we could change them in the middle of the night in the event of any vomit or diaper incidents. The sheets don't have slits for those straps but we're still able to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Collins

customer_reviews.title: A nightmare to set up and collapse for storage. A total and absolute pain.
customer_reviews.text: Fingers and thumb were sore at initial set up and we didn't ever know that we could even collapse it because it was simply a nightmare to collapse it. Side buttons are either stuck or too loose and will bot do what the manual says they will do...assuming you can actually press them. Then comes the time I needed to aet it up for a guest... one side wouldn't lock back in place. These guys are shrewd enough to not have a longer than one year warranty on it. Amazon will not touch the warranty either. Such a pain and a disappointment. I doubt that I shall have the guts to travel with it.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Mula

customer_reviews.title: Great for travelling
customer_reviews.text: We use it as an every day crib and I would not recommend to use it without matress. As a travel bad or for occasional overnights it is a perfect one: easy to assemble, easy to move from one room to another.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: I like the color palette
customer_reviews.text: We had one from 2009, but lost a pole so we bought this one. I like the color palette. It's nice and neutral. It works well enough. The size is good. It's easy to put together. The bar with the clouds isn't that stable, which is a bit worrisome. Additionally the foam mattress seems lumpy in places. It's adequate, but not above and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: SSC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a human child but I have a snake (ball python) and I wanted to get her something that I could bring her outside with during the summer so that the ants won't get to her and this seemed to be the perfect thing. It was easy to unfold and set up, pretty heavy, but easy to fold up as well to keep it aside so that it's not in the way when we don't need it. The padding piece that goes inside is heavy enough that I hope she will not be able to get underneath since she likes to explore.
customer_reviews.author: IllumiFox

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed. Bottom bends.
customer_reviews.text: Dissapointed. I like Graco products but this one was not good. I do like that it is compact but the bottom bends under the weight of my 7 month old (15 lbs) making it uncomfortable for him and thus, useless. It had great reviews. Hope you have better luck. Wish I could return it but my husband threw away the box.
customer_reviews.author: Liliana

customer_reviews.title: This item is very easy to open and close and the baby falls right to sleep everytime!
customer_reviews.text: This item was bought for my daughter & husbands newborn son and it was a great hit! It is attractive and so very easy to open and close. Additionally, it is lightweight enough to move to different locations when needed. It travels well and again, is easy to set up when visiting family and friends. The baby took to it immediately; and slept so well. I would recommend this product to anyone having a baby or needing to buy a baby gift. The price was very reasonable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Love Graco
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased Graco pack and plays for all 3 of my children and this one by far is the best. I guess they've improved on some of the basic things like the buttons going around to help let down the playard. It doesn't take up a lot of space. I just traveled with it this weekend and it was perfect. I love that it comes with a travel bag as well. I will be buying Another one for my niece in A few months.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Patience when assembling
customer_reviews.text: While it is easy to fold, assembling it was a different story. It took a few tries to get the sides to straighten out. We had to fold and then reassemble a couple times which can be annoying especially if you have a waiting baby. Overall, it’s a good product once assembled. I haven’t used it yet but it looks sturdy and mobile which I like. It folds up compact and comes with a bag and its own handle. It will be easy to take anywhere. I’m looking forward to using this. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty easy to work but I did have a little ...
customer_reviews.text: I unboxed it and set it up for the first time very quickly. It's pretty easy to work but I did have a little bit of an issue breaking it down the first time. Turns out if you read and follow the directions you won't have any issues. Mine DID come with a cover/bag. Some people indicated that their unit didn't. One thing that I like is that the handle for carrying is attached to the pack n play, not the bag. So there is less likelihood that the handle will tear off the bag or become unstable. Just a little thing but those kinds of things make a difference sometime. Otherwise this was all I expected it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Hswilliams

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product , my baby doesn't like swings or baby chairs so it was a struggle when needing to do stuff on the house , with this playyard I can safely place him inside and he stays calm while I am able to do stuff around the house while still keeping an eye on him all the time. Its strong as well easy to clean , also pretty easy to transport it room to room.
customer_reviews.author: Marinette Feliciano

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and held up well except mattress raising in the middle
customer_reviews.text: 2 years later still Using! I took this with for nap time away from home plus bed time at home it has been great. My only complaint is the mattress created a crease that sticks up inthe middle over time. I use a mattress pad and sheet but you can feel the bubble of material in the middle of the bed. Unsure how to fix the f I had another child thinking would need a new one so the bed part is completely flat. When it got dirty able to wash outside and scrub easily. Very easy to set up and take with you.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: It's great
customer_reviews.text: As far as play pens go, I like graco brand. I bought a diff graco pen at target, and I like it too. Easy to assemble (just snap the top sides first before spreading out), and easy to roll on its wheels. It seems all play pens dip at the bottom, so I put a folded up quilt under the main floor pad, then bought a play pen mattress and sheet. It's very comfortable now for my 5 month old baby to play or nap (she uses the other one I have in the same manner as her bed in her room)! This one also matches my brown living room furniture. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Delci

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is so cute and perfect for baby seems durable mattress pad that's with is would not be suitable for baby to sleep on we bought a mattress to go in it for comfortably sometimes it's a pain to open and close but once you have the tricks down it's all good ... the bassinet part we can't get to pack/fit in the carry bag for travel so we have to take that separate over all though we are satisfied with our purchase and baby loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Haack

customer_reviews.title: Hard assembly if alone but worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This playpen was not as easy as others to set up. Had alot of snaps and bars to lock in place that don’t seem to want to unless you snap really hard. I hate putting this thing up. Taking it down is easier for sure. Aside from that, i love it. Perfect size, love the carry bag. The mat is easy to clean and my baby loves it. It’s become a toy bin but when we use it he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amomofkids

customer_reviews.title: Playpen
customer_reviews.text: I had a playpen long ago like this one. Read the instructions on how to assemble and it will be easy for you. I bought this for my grandson but he isn’t one to be confined.😊So I gave it to a friend of my daughter-in-laws who really appreciated it. You will like this product. Sturdy,colorful and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Cooks

customer_reviews.title: Best Pack n' Play I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: We have gone through a few pack n' plays from a few different vendors. This Graco Pack n' Play is the best we have used! - The quality of the fabric and stitching is top notch - Infant bassinet attachment is useful for the first few months of your baby's life - Frame is very durable and easy to fold - The toy bar is very basic, but I only really used it while using the infant bassinet attachment I am very happy with this purchase and will be getting one for all of my friends that are having kids
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Versatile! A must have for travel
customer_reviews.text: Folding and unfolding took a few tries however the item is very sturdy. My 8 month old is very busy and curious so she is constantly scratching the mesh sides and pulling up. The material was cooling for outdoors in 90 degree weather and wasn't "sticky". Also the ease of traveling was the greatest relief. You simply use the inside mattress which has a thick padding and hard shell to fold the pack and play up into the carrying case. It was very compact and light to carry. Most importantly it checked off all the boxes for what it was intended for, quick easy travel, used outdoors and as a travel crib.
customer_reviews.author: Julisa Riley

customer_reviews.title: Portable and very easy to ship!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this crib for my brother’s first baby who lives overseas, and I really liked its size, portability, and simplicity. I was able to put it in a box and send it abroad with no worries about size. My only regret was I didn’t wait until it became “On Sale”, otherwise, I could have gotten it at a lower price in amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mikaela SJTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great bed for when our grandson comes to visit!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for when our 6 month old grandson comes to stay and it works perfectly! I am very pleased with it. It is very nice and easy to assemble. It is the perfect size for him without all of the frills that many have, so it is a no nonsense bed that is nice, well made and perfect for him! I love how easy it is to set up and use and then break down for storage. The price was amazing and I would highly recommend it to anyone needed a bed for their baby! It is so cute and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Mimi Needed A Pack 'n Play at Her House
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and son-in-law have a Pack 'n Play at their house that they were bringing to my house with them when they came for a visit or for the holidays. I decided it would be better, and more convenient, for me to have my own so they didn't have to load their car with so much. My version is different than theirs but still absolutely perfect! And the color and pattern I chose (Zuba) is perfect in brown and green. Besides that it is sturdy, easy to assemble and easy to fold. Graco is a tried and true brand!
customer_reviews.author: Jann

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - PLEASE READ
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for a vacation and had it delivered to our destination. I never write reviews but I had to for this one. The playpen itself is easy to use but there is a chemical smell. I thought the smell would air out being that it was a new product. I used it for 2 nights. The second night I noticed that my baby’s clothes etc smelled like this chemical smell even though I had a sheet over the bottom of it. Beware of this product ... do not buy. I have a different Graco pack and play at home and it does not smell like this.
customer_reviews.author: Petal

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: I got this Pack-n-Play to replace one I used when my 4.5-year-old son was a baby (and let a friend borrow for her baby)---when I got it back, it was wrecked. Anyway, the design is adorable (I got Zuba), and you can't ask for an easier setup. The bassinet is very handy for my 3-week-old (and at the present time, my cat...) The mat that goes inside ended up splitting in half on my old one (which was the reason for having to buy this one) but there's no telling what happened to it while my friend borrowed it, so I can't say for sure that it's due to poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson comes to visit and his parents usually have to carry around their own port a crib, which is a pain. I decided to buy my own, but didn't want to spend a lot of money, as he will soon out grow it. For the price, I expected it to be a cheaper model and not that great. I was blown away when it came. It is sturdy, easy to set up and no extra mattress needed. I did buy a quilted mattress cover though for extra comfort. This is a great buy and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra LaPera

customer_reviews.title: Great for puppies, too!
customer_reviews.text: Just love this crib for my Pomeranian puppy! She is so comfy and calm in it. I can keep her right by my bed, which is comforting for her. And then I can use the bassinet to do her grooming. So it’s great to be able to take that in and out so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jill McGowan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pack n' Play
customer_reviews.text: I love the pattern and colors of this pack n' play. I'm using for my newborn son after he's born, but it could easily be used for girls as well. I'm currently 7 months pregnant and was able to put this together in about 5 minutes. We had another Pack n' Play for our daughter as a newborn which included the infant changer and sleeper. I like this one better, it will be used for newborn naptime at first with the newborn insert and the adorable toy bar is a plus, which was not included on my daughter's 8+ years ago. Thank you again Graco, for a great product! :)
customer_reviews.author: GoRun1919

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed and nothing more
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my three month old and I wish I'd bought it earlier. It works great for naps and tummy time away from our bedroom. So easy to use and set up, great price. I'm glad I went with the basic version instead of all the newborn add-ons, they just wouldn't have been useful for long enough. It's easy enough to change a diaper on this at my in laws house too. I use extra regular crib sheets with this because I didn't think about ordering all the special bedding products for this at the same time and honestly it works fine. I bought this on sale for $60 and I'm happy the price and product.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Good for my fledging parrot
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy-to-use (and store folded, overnight) place for my young parrot to learn to walk, flap, and climb. Just like a baby human you still need to supervise, but there is no strong outgassing fume (I let it sit outdoors for a couple of hours for the plastic smell to go away, but I probably did not have to). For the price it's totally worth it. Would work for most size parrots (mine's a midsize macaw).
customer_reviews.author: gmtenor

customer_reviews.title: No instructions, but worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very big playpen, but it was exactly what I needed since my baby likes to move a lot. She uses one side to push her push toy and the other side has her toys in one corner and a an area to nap in the other corner. There are no instructions, so it takes a bit to get started. But once you can figure it out, the setup is actually pretty easy. The only drawback is that you cannot "close it up" like other playpens. If you want to move it or put it away, you need to actually take it apart. But it is definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Noah

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind (Using my Grandfather's account)
customer_reviews.text: (My name is Kelly and I am using my grandfather's account.) I am a mom of 2 under 2. This pack in play is perfect for me using it in the bedroom as a crib/bassinet. The suspended toys offer my little one entertainment and I often hear her cooing at the toys. I love having my kids less than 5 feet from me especially to nurse the youngest at night. It is very sturdy and very easy to take down. We have also used it by the pool for a safe, yet comfortable place to be with the breathable mesh offering a breeze to flow through. I definately recommend this to all my 1st time mom friends.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Seriously??!!  SO fed up with Amazon lately.
customer_reviews.text: What did I dislike?? I dislike anxiously awaiting a new Pack n Play for infant granddaughter only to receive this!!! In fairness to the product, it wasn't given a chance for Stars due to this. Multiple epic fails and inconveniences with Amazon and UPS shipping just THIS WEEK! Grrrrrrr
customer_reviews.author: PamelaMac

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 3 Already
customer_reviews.text: I bought a total of 3. The first one with the bassinet for my granddaughter. Then I bought a 2nd one to keep at my house for my granddaughter. We took an eighteen hour roadtrip recently and one of these went with us. We used it in the hotel and friend's house. It took up very little space in the car. The third one I purchased for my great great nephew came with the bassinet. His grandmother loves it. I would recommend these all day. Don't pay all that money on those overpriced ones, trust me these will work just as well.
customer_reviews.author: dfleming

customer_reviews.title: Great product, would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am really happy with this product. Purchased it for a second pack in play to keep at my office for my son. He naps really good in it. At first I was looking at one with the napper and changing table, but I found I have not missed having all the extras. Very easy to set up. I ended up not using the bassinet, I just lay him in the bottom. Great design for either a boy or a girl. It is kinda heavy, but that’s ok... I can still handle it fine. The price is really good, it seems to be made of quality material and very sturdy. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna M.

customer_reviews.title: Ok But Needs Work
customer_reviews.text: Once the play yard is set up, it is fine. Getting all of the joints to either straighten or fold at the same time is a bit of a battle as it is so heavy. The joints don't automatically snap into or out of place when you pull the center up or push it down. Has a nice cover,and fits easily, but no handle for carrying, so you must improvise. Working out the stiff joints and making a handle to carry would be a great improvement.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: This pack n play is great. We bought this for our guest suite. I thought it would be too small and cheap because of the packaging as well as the low price tag but was pleasantly surprised when I opened it up. It's a normal size, lightweight, easy to assemble, good quality, and doesn't take up much space. My only complaint would be that there's no handles on the carrier case. Other than that, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gunsmoke1983

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy! There's a trick to putting it together easily
customer_reviews.text: We really like this! We bought it for a little dog to sleep in at night. It's sturdy, easy for travel. One thing that will help you pull up the sides and make it sturdy is if you understand to pull all four sides up before you push the middle down. Usually you can pull up two sides, push down the center of the pen and the other two sides click. But, in this case, pull up all four sides and then mess with the middle. I say buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: odd coating on fabric
customer_reviews.text: I normally like the Graco Pack 'n Play, but this one has an odd coating on the fabric (mattress and tops of sides.) This item is a good price, but I think Graco has really down graded their pack 'n plays in the last several years. I feel almost as though these pack 'n play travel beds last only for one child, and then I would not trust them for another child... I wish Graco would improve their quality because I love the ease of use of this pack 'n play for travel!
customer_reviews.author: OneBusyMama

customer_reviews.title: Not the most durable (lightweight compared to some)
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price! This is not the most sturdy Pack 'n Play I have come across but it does the job nicely and for the price you can't go wrong. It is rather light weight and the mattress is not as heavy duty as some more expensive brands. I haven't had the chance to use the bassinet. I have taken this everywhere though and it is light weight compared to some. it is extremely easy to set up and dismantle as well. The wheels are a great feature for moving this around by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: NJM

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of these beds/pens.
customer_reviews.text: Always a pain in the a$$ to set these up. For my preference, the mat is thin, but will suffice in a pinch. Purchased this for our granddaughter. We used it a few times, found it was more of a pain than an ease. We ended up purchasing a big baby gate system that you can turn into a play pen. For what the item is, its cute. It breaks down fairly small. Easy to move when set up. Easy to pack when broken down.
customer_reviews.author: D Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Great travel crib!
customer_reviews.text: Used this over the holidays as a crib for our 8 month old baby. It was super easy to set-up and take down which was great since we were traveling. Firm enough that I wasn’t worried about my baby sleeping on it and sturdy enough that he was able to hang out in it while awake as well. We did purchase a sheet for it so that he wasn’t sleeping on just the pad it comes with which I thought was a little rough to the touch. Also, very compact when rolled up in its carrier!
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Busted and Defective
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and it arrived fairly quickly. When I tried setting it up one side simply would not latch no matter what we tried. I went to return it but when I went to take it down the 3 sides that did latch wouldnt unlatch. Had to call and notify them that I couldn't mail it back since I couldn't disassemble it. It looks nice and everything but we cant use it with a busted side. They did give a full refund though and I dont have to mail it back. Now I just have a junk pack n play to get rid of somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Albright

customer_reviews.title: Never leave baby in the car again!
customer_reviews.text: With the Pack 'n Play by Graco, you'll never leave your baby in the car again!! Why?!? Because now you can leave your baby at home, thanks to Graco!! The soft, elevated walls will keep your child from running around the house while you're gone, and minimize injury should the fall into it. The soft bottom is also helpful for catching your baby when it falls. Available in gender neutral colors only, since your child is obviously too young to choose it's identity. But wait, there's more!! If your child grows up and decides to be a Dogkin, this will easily convert into a dog kennel!! Lucky you.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Great travel Pak n’ Play for young baby
customer_reviews.text: The Pack ‘n Play was easy to assemble and very sturdy. It has added straps to even more secure the bottom to the unit for baby safety. My only complaint was in taking the unit down. No where in the directions did it say to pull up on the sides in order to push the button in to lower each side. I struggled for a few minutes thinking my arthritic hands were not getting the job done. Adding a note to the directions to “pull up” before pressing button would be very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Buffs Mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a lot bigger than I thought it would be. But it is perfect. We weren't ready (still aren't) to put our son in his crib. This was the perfect solution. He's been sleeping at the foot of our bed in this since he was born. He's almost five months now. He has really grown into it. It was easy for my hubby to put together. It's easy to move and it's perfect for our son. We love it. Will definitely regift it once he outgrows it.
customer_reviews.author: Hunny B

customer_reviews.title: Mattress quickly has become too dangerous to use
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many Graco products over the years and have always previously been very pleased with the quality. However, I purchased this Pack 'n Play for my infant grandson and within weeks of use the mattress has buckled and pops up on one of the creases causing this to be very dangerous and unusable for my 4 month old grandson.
customer_reviews.author: johngilb

customer_reviews.title: Good size; great for grandma's
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this play yard for use when my toddler grandson visits my home. It is good-sized and has wheels on one end, which surprisingly aren't as useful as I thought they might be. It is a little tricky to open and shut but once you get the hang of it, it is fairly simple. It is a little on the heavy side but folds up small enough to store in a small space.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline H. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Our baby always coughs when play inside this playard
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good example of a maker that is not thinking about the end consumer's experience. By the consumer I mean a baby that will be playing inside the playard. Since our baby grew up enough to easily reach the cushioned borders of the playard she started chewing it. Of course the stuffing of those borders (polyester fiber) started pulling out of the cushions and causing cough. Not sure if we can return this playard after almost 4 months from the purchase date.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksei

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to assemble/break down and it’s compact. My only complaint is that the pad does not lay flat, which is concerning when you have a newborn in it. It lays flat when there’s no weight on it but when I put my baby in it, the middle lays flat and the two ends will fold into an incline. It serves its purpose but I would probably spend a little more money on a better design.
customer_reviews.author: PMEM

customer_reviews.title: Great product really, it mine just seem to squeak with movements sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Not too heavy, not too light and super easy to assemble. The only thing is the squeaking! It squeaks when my 15month old walks in it. I’ve bought this one and have it shipped to my new address so I didn’t have it go back and forth from NY to TN with it but it’s ok ok noisy...on the upside, I know when my little guy is starting to wake up
customer_reviews.author: deraa

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pack n play for newborn to toddler
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get a second pack n play for my second baby. Graco is q great brand that make quality products. Sturdy, easy to assemble, fold, tranport, and clean. Trust me the first one survived every sort of stains and the wrath of a rambunctious one year old who was able to climb it, flip it upside down and drag it across the room.
customer_reviews.author: twinklestar

customer_reviews.title: Netting is cheaply made 2nd Time I had to Return
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this more stars but this is the second one I’ve purchased having to return the first and now sending back the second barely used 2 months. First one I had barely a week. The netting on this one is very cheap, it’s hard crisp netting that doesn’t give and so it tears easily like by my six month old touching it with his little fingers and nails. I have an evenflo one that I had for years and it’s still n great condition. I’m going to have say to no this brand. I really like the easy setup and color/design but sadly it’s useless if netting doesn’t stay in tack.
customer_reviews.author: Kara  Adair

customer_reviews.title: Great pack n play with the full size bassinet!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bassinet! We purchased this for the grandparent's house so our newborn has somewhere to be changed and rest while we visit. I have the 4moms breeze play yard with the changing area and bassinet, but honestly the pack n play version is much more useable because of the "full" size bassinet. For the price this pen is a win!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Simple. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Super cute, gender-neutral PNP. It’s the second one I’ve bought of this exact item (first one was destroyed by a pet). It is so easy to collapse/fold and is easy to set up compared to many other PNPs of other brands I’ve used (of comparable or lower price). I definitely recommend this PNP for anyone looking for a simple item without all the cumbersome extras. I love having the infant insert, as it definitely comes in handy during those first couple of weeks when baby is tiny and mom is still sore (don’t have to bend all the way into the PNP).
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Gelesky

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pack and play for a trip to Tennessee. I had it shipped right to my aunts house so I didn’t have to bring it on the airplane. It was on sale through amazon warehouse for a “printing issue” the only issue I see is the print is upside down. Seems so silly to me because the babies sleep in it so what does it matter if the print is upside down? The product is still so cute and in perfect condition! It arrived in one day and packaging was amazing! Best sale ever!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for grandchild visits. Easy to put together. It really only took 5 minutes after a quick review of the instructions. Folds up easily and right back in the carrying case. Like the neutral grey color. Will probably purchase something else to hang over the baby as the little stars are not to my liking as I feel easily pulled off by the baby.
customer_reviews.author: KA Mpls

customer_reviews.title: Good product, irritating price change.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product. I was dreading having to put it together but it was a snap.It took all of ten minutes. The mattress is a bit thin but I purchased the Grace quilted sheets to cover that problem. What Idon’t like is that I ordered this product on 12/13 and today 12/16 it is $6 less. How do I request a refund? UPDATE: Amazon refused to credit my account for the price change. It was suggested I return and repurchase the item. Then take a day off to wait for redelivery. Not in this lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: avid consumer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Baby!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pack an play for my 4 month old GrandPrincess. She loves it! Such a good baby, she is put to bed and off to sleep she goes. She loves the roominess. This pack and play allows her to stretch out. She seems to sleep better and shes sleeping longer and more comfy. So glad for the purchase. Her parents use it at home and then pack it up to take to Gammie's house!! Happy Gammie 🤗!!
customer_reviews.author: Gammie

customer_reviews.title: Easy for travel - we love this product!
customer_reviews.text: We love the Graco Pack 'n Play. We have purchased maybe four or five of these over the past two years (our own for weekend trips, two for the grandparents' houses on opposite coasts, one for a recent destination wedding that we gifted to the bride to use for her niece, and one as a gift). These are sturdy, lightweight, easily packable. Once you get past the infant stage with the mobile, it gets VERY easy to pack this up in a jiffy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get it !
customer_reviews.text: Love it it is spacious and sturdy. Can be put away quickly. Was tricky to open up but just two of the sides have to be pulled up and out before the other two sides. Not difficult but just be mindful of which side to open up first. Is light to pick up and move around. My baby is now 6 months and I put him here to play or sit while I do things .
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Can be used for years to come.
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I could safely put my son in here while I did dishes, laundry, or vacuumed. He has been sick and we’ve even put it in our bedroom so he would go to sleep. I should’ve had one of these with the bassinet and changing table all along. My son is 13 months today, and I just got our first pack and play. Would recommend this over any bassinet bc you can continuously use it for years to come. You can purchase mattresses separately for the pack and play. I got the Dream on Me 3”. The mattresses the pack and plays come with are super thin, but they make them that way for safety reasons.
customer_reviews.author: David & Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Very good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple pack n play but perfect for what we needed it for. We wanted our newborn to have a good flat surface to sleep on while in our bedroom without spending a fortune on a bassinet that won’t be used long. We’ve had almost a month and our little guy sleeps great in it. It doesn’t have a bunch of fancy things like some others do and I’ve never felt like it’s missing anything. Plus when he gets bigger he’s got the pack n play to play in. Well worth the price and we’re very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DTurnbo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect but I should’ve waited till baby was older..
customer_reviews.text: I love this pack-n-play so much!! Now that my baby is almost 3 months, he’s getting more used to used the bassinet.. it won’t be long till we’ll have take away the bassinet add-on and put the “bed” flat deep in the pack-n-play sigh they grow too fast. Even though I love it and it is useful at times, we mostly co-sleep. If I could do it all again, I would’ve gotten a tiny bassinet with wheels (if that -maybe a swing instead) and later on worried about the pack-n-play. Even though we travel, it hasn’t need THAT useful since baby’s not very mmm playful? Lol
customer_reviews.author: Mariem

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for all my kids and I love them. They work great and are easy to go places with. I love these because you can take them with you everywhere and the baby isn’t sleeping in a “new” place. It’s something familiar and they sleep so much better when we visit family. My first one lasted about 3 years before it started sticking a little, but by then we were already in the toddler bed. We got this one for the new baby and it’s just as good as my first one. They collapse at the press of a button. In about 5 minutes I’ve got the babies bed packed and In the car.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Good and short!!
customer_reviews.text: I reluctantly give this 5 stars because at 21 months the little bastard learned how to climb out. Throws his giant stuffed mickey on the floor and uses it as a landing cushion. This all happened today on the 4th of July. I suppose it is his independence day. Best for kids 20 months and younger. Clean, light, portable, sturdy and short.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Haller

customer_reviews.title: Bassinet is a Great Feature
customer_reviews.text: Great durable pack n play. We used it for months with our newborn and the bassinet helps a new mom's tired back - no bending all they way down to pick up the teeny baby. Great feature. I think the ones with the bassinet and changing tables are too much - it's very easy to change a baby in the bassinet feature, so save your money! Easy to set up and packs up nicely and we have taken this on many trips. Our two year old sleeps in it when we go to grandma's house but it's about to outgrow it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I like this for when I travel and stay at other people's houses. Big enough for them to sleep in or play in. Easy to use and assemble. I haven't had any problems with it. I would recommend to anyone having a child. It is better than the child sleeping on the floor or rolling off the bed- depending on age and such. I love this!
customer_reviews.author: Linzer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I thought I would be
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. I wanted something to put my newborn in downstairs to sleep in. And what stood out to me was the bassinet feature. So if I'm cooking or need to go to the bathroom or doing any type of chore downstairs. I know that I have a safe place to put her (attended of course) And I like the play yard, because when she starts to crawl, it's nice to put her in that part while I'm working.
customer_reviews.author: Jacklyn St.Clair

product_meta.title: Graco Pack and Play Portable Playard | Push Button Compact Fold, Carnival
product_meta.description: Color:Carnival| Style:Portable PlayardWhen your little one needs a place to nap or play right away, there's no more convenient solution than our Pack 'n Play Playard. Its durable frame makes it perfectly suited for travel. The signature Graco push-button fold allows you to break it down in seconds, and the automatically folding feet and wheels make it amazingly compact when folded. At home or away, your young one will have sweet dreams and comfy surroundings. No bleach. Clean with household soap and warm water/drip dry.
feature_bullets: Automatically folding feet and wheels allow for a compact fold for easy storage and transportation
Durable frame makes this portable Playard ideal for travel
Signature Graco Pack 'n Play push button fold makes closing your Playard quick and hassle free
Airy mesh on all sides provides maximum ventilation

specifications.Care instructions: No bleach. Clean with household soap and warm water/drip dry.Machine wash carry bag in lukewarm water/drip dry , If playard gets sandy, carefully remove sand from all surfaces before packing into bag as sand can damage top rail lock
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars12,076 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
